question: 2021 World Series: Who will win Braves v. Astros Game 3 on October 29th?
description:
In the MLB 2021 World Series Game 3:

If the Atlanta Braves win, the market will resolve to “Braves.” 

If the Houston Astros win, the market will resolve to “Astros.” 

If the game is not completed by November 4, 2021, the market will resolve 48-52 favoring “Astros.”

----------------------------------------------

The 2021 World Series is the championship series of Major League Baseball's (MLB) 2021 season. 
The 117th edition of the World Series is a best-of-seven playoff played between the National League (NL) champion Atlanta Braves and the American League (AL) champion Houston Astros. 

The series is began on October 26, with a potential Game 7 scheduled for November 3. Current score after two games: 1-1.

Game 3 is scheduled to start on October 29, 8pm ET and will be played in Trust Park, Atlanta, GA.

question: Will $MATIC (Polygon) be above $2 on Halloween?
description:
This is a market on whether the candlestick close price of Polygon $MATIC will be above $2.00 for the date and time of October 31, 2021, at 11:30 PM ET. 

The resolution source for this market will be prices listed on CoinGecko (https://www.coingecko.com/en/coins/polygon). 

This market will resolve to “Yes” if, according to the resolution source, $MATIC has a candlestick closing price of greater than $2.00 for the resolution date, October 31, 2021, 11:30 PM ET after 11:30 PM ET has passed. 
Otherwise, this market will resolve to “No”. 

(To see the candlestick close price, click the candlestick icon, observe the number after the “C:” when you hover over a candlestick for a given time period.)

This market will resolve on the “C” (i.e. closing price) listed for the candle titled “Sun 31 October 2021, 23:30:00” with the “Price” tab selected, in the Eastern Time Zone. Note, this 23:30:00 candle lists the opening price for 11:00:00 PM ET and the closing price for 11:30:00 PM ET. To allow for updates, this market will resolve on the number listed for the referenced candle at exactly 11:50:00 PM ET, on October 31, 2021. Note: If the candlestick closing price is exactly 2.00, the market will resolve "No." If CoinGecko is unavailable at resolution time, another source will be used.

question: Will the 76ers beat the Pistons by more than 9.5 points in their October 28th matchup?
description:
In the upcoming NBA game:

If the Philadelphia 76ers win by over 9.5 points, the market will resolve to “Yes”.

If the Detroit Pistons lose by less than 9.5 points or win, the market will resolve “No.” 

If the game is not completed by November 3, 2021, the market will resolve 50-50.

question: Which cryptocurrency will have higher market cap on November 4th: $DOGE or $SHIB?
description:
This is a market on the Market Cap comparison of two cryptocurrencies: Dogecoin ($DOGE) and Shiba Inu ($SHIB) for the resolution date and time of November 4, 2021, at 8:00 PM ET. 

The resolution source for this market will be market cap ranking on CoinGecko (https://www.coingecko.com/en). 

If, according to the resolution source, $DOGE has a greater market cap than $SHIB on the resolution date,  this market will resolve to “Dogecoin”. If $SHIB has a greater market cap than $DOGE on the resolution date, this market will resolve to “Shiba Inu”. If the estimated market cap for the resolution date is exactly the same for both cryptocurrencies, this market will resolve 50/50.

If for any reason the resolution data is unavailable at the resolution time, another credible source will be checked such as CoinMarketCap. In the event of ambiguity in terms of the market outcome, historical market caps of each coin will be used (https://www.coingecko.com/en/coins/shiba-inu, https://www.coingecko.com/en/coins/dogecoin), precisely the first recorded measurement after 8:00 PM.
--------------
Market Cap = Current Price x Circulating Supply

Refers to the total market value of a cryptocurrency’s circulating supply.

question: Will the price of $MATIC (Polygon) or $ADA (Cardano) be higher on November 4th?
description:
This is a market on the price comparison of two cryptocurrencies: Cardano ($ADA) and Polygon ($MATIC) for the resolution time of November 4, 2021, at 8:00 PM ET. 

The resolution source for this market will be prices listed on CoinGecko (https://www.coingecko.com/en). 

If, according to the resolution source, $ADA has a greater candlestick closing price (C) than $MATIC at the resolution time,  this market will resolve to “Cardano”. If, according to the resolution source, $MATIC has a greater candlestick closing price (C) than $ADA at the resolution time, this market will resolve to “Polygon”. 

If the candlestick closing price of both cryptocurrencies up to the hundredth decimal place is exactly the same at the resolution time, this market will resolve 50-50.

If for any reason the resolution data is unavailable, another credible source will be used.
-----------------------------------------------
C - This market will resolve on the “C” (i.e. closing price) listed for the candle titled “Thu 04 November 2021, 20:00:00” with the “Price” tab selected, in the Eastern Time Zone. 

To see the candlestick close price, click the candlestick icon on the cryptocurrency price chart, observe the number after the “C:” when you hover over a candlestick for a given time period.

Note, this 20:00:00 candle lists the opening price for 07:30:00 PM ET and the closing price for 08:00:00 PM ET. To allow for updates, this market will resolve on the number listed for the referenced candle at exactly 8:25 PM ET, on November 4, 2021.

question: Will inflation be 0.5% or more from September to October 2021?
description:
This is a market on a month-to-month inflation, as measured by the Bureau of Labor Statistics (CPI-U), from September to October 2021.

The inflation is measured by a change in Consumer Price Index for All Urban Consumers (CPI-U) on a seasonally adjusted basis, reported by U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics.

This market will resolve to “Yes” if the index increased by 0.5 percent or more (i.e. fifty-hundredths of 1%) from September 2021 to October 2021 and "No" otherwise.

The resolution source for this market will be the BLS October 2021 Consumer Price Index report (https://www.bls.gov/bls/news-release/cpi.htm), currently scheduled for release on November 10, 2021, 8:30 AM ET. Resolution of this market will take place upon release of the aforementioned data. 

-------------------------
The Consumer Price Index (CPI) is a measure of the average change over time in the prices paid by urban consumers for a market basket of consumer goods and services.

Note that the resolution source for this market will be the official monthly BLS CPI news release which reports seasonally-adjusted month-to-month inflation to only one decimal point (e.g. 0.6%, 0.5%, etc). Thus, this is the level of precision that will be used when resolving the market (e.g. if seasonally adjusted month-to-month CPI-U is 0.3%, the market will resolve to “No”, if it is 0.5%, this market will resolve to “Yes”).
